sailpoint.object

Class CertificationItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.AbstractCertificationItem
          • sailpoint.object.CertificationItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<CertificationItem>, Notifiable, Phaseable, WorkItemOwnerChangeListener, sailpoint.tools.WatchableMap.Watcher<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class CertificationItem
extends AbstractCertificationItem
implements Notifiable, Phaseable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<CertificationItem>
    The state of one item within an Certification.

    There are several types of certification item that use different properties.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isNeedsContinuousFlush

        public boolean isNeedsContinuousFlush()
        True when the decision has been flushed to the history immediately when a decision is made and not pending review. This prevents the Certificationer from flushing continuous items multiple times.

        Description copied from interface: Phaseable

      • getNextPhaseTransition

        public java.util.Date getNextPhaseTransition()
        The date at which the next Phase transition should occur for this item. This is null for periodic (non-continuous) certifications. Periodic certification store phase information on the certification itself. This gets recalculated any time a phase is transitioned (initially when the certification is started and transitions to the Active phase). A null value signifies that there are no more transitions remaining.
        Specified by:
        getNextPhaseTransition in interface Phaseable

      • setNextPhaseTransition

        public void setNextPhaseTransition(java.util.Date next)
        Description copied from interface: Phaseable
        Set the date at which the next phase transition should occur.
        Specified by:
        setNextPhaseTransition in interface Phaseable

      • getBundleEntitlements

        public java.util.List<EntitlementSnapshot> getBundleEntitlements()
        For the Bundle type.

        This is the collection of actual entitlements held by the Identity that matched the definition of the role. This is optional, if set it is intended for display only.

      • setExceptionEntitlements

        public void setExceptionEntitlements(EntitlementSnapshot ents)

      • getExceptionEntitlements

        public EntitlementSnapshot getExceptionEntitlements()
        For the Exception type.

        The additional entitlements that are being certified. Note that depending on the granularity of the certification, other items in the same certification can reference the same application or attribute/permission, but with different values.

        public PolicyViolation getPolicyViolation()
        For the PolicyViolation type. The actual violation object.

        this is a private copy that is serialize with the item.

      • getViolationSummary

        public java.lang.String getViolationSummary()
        For the PolicyViolation type. A possibly truncated summary of the violation. Storing this in addition to the violation so there is easier access to the summary instead of having to load and deserialize the entire violation. This is required for sorting and for projection queries.

      • getChallenge

        public CertificationChallenge getChallenge()

      • getAttributes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAttributes()

      • setExtended

        public void setExtended(int index,
               java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        Hibernate requires a getter and setter pair for mapped columns. All of the numbered methods forward to this generic method which by default does nothing but can be overridden in a subclass in case it does not want to use an attributes map.

        setExtended in class SailPointObject

      • bulkCertify

        public java.util.List<CertificationItem> bulkCertify(Identity who,
                                            java.lang.String workItem,
                                            CertificationAction bulkAction,
                                            CertificationItemSelector selector,
                                            boolean autoClose)
                                              throws GeneralException
        Bulk certify this item using the status and properties from the given action. This does not modify the status on a policy violation item.
        Specified by:
        bulkCertify in class AbstractCertificationItem
        Parameters:
        who - The Identity performing the bulk certification.
        workItem - The ID of the work item in which the bulk certify is taking place.
        bulkAction - The bulk action that contains the status and parameters to use to bulk certify this item.
        selector - The selector used to determine if this item is to be bulk certified. If null, bulk certify this item.
        autoClose - Whether this bulk certification is part of an auto cert close. This allows some cert items (currently just policy violations) to be bulk certified that would otherwise not be permitted. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED FOR TESTING OR AUTO CERT CLOSING!
        Returns:
        A possibly empty list of CertificationItems that were not bulk certified.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • allowAccountLevelActions

        public boolean allowAccountLevelActions()
        Return whether account-level actions (for example - approve/revoke account) are allowed on this item.

      • allowAccountLevelActions

        public static boolean allowAccountLevelActions(CertificationItem.Type type,
                               java.lang.String appName,
                               Certification.Type certType)
        Return whether account-level actions (for example - approve/revoke account) are allowed on an item with the given properties. This method is required because there might be a sparse representation of a certification item from a projection query.

      • useRevokeAccountInsteadOfRevoke

        public boolean useRevokeAccountInsteadOfRevoke()
        Return whether the revoke account should be used in favor of revoke for this item.

      • useRevokeAccountInsteadOfRevoke

        public static boolean useRevokeAccountInsteadOfRevoke(Certification cert,
                                      CertificationItem.Type itemType,
                                      boolean allowBulkAccountActions)
        Return whether the revoke account should be used in favor of revoke for an item with the given properties. This method is required because there might a sparse representation of a certification item from a projection query.
        Parameters:
        cert - Certification to check
        itemType - Type of the item. If you are dealing with multiple items such as in a bulk action, this might be null.
        allowBulkAccountActions - True if bulk account actions are allowed.
        Returns:
        True if revoke account should be used in favor of revoke.

      • getObjectConfig

        public static ObjectConfig getObjectConfig()
        This one is unusual in that IdentityIQ shares the same configuration as Link.class. It turns out this class can just be passed in because there has to be a mapping for CertificationItem anyway for Hibernate.

      • getSortComparator

        public static java.util.Comparator<CertificationItem> getSortComparator(boolean secondarySort)

      • getSortKey

        public java.lang.String getSortKey()
        Sorting these are strange because the list can contain different types of things. IdentityIQ is not going to try to sort by type THEN by name, just pick a relevant key to use this can cause the types to be interleaved.

      • getSecondarySortKey

        public java.lang.String getSecondarySortKey()
        This method was added for unit tests only. If the result of getSortComparator is 0 (the values are equal) we'll use the secondary sort key to sort further.
        Returns:
        _exceptionAttributeValue or empty string
